meanings.sent1: The fluky meeting with an old friend made my day.
meanings.sent2: It was a fluky coincidence that we both wore the same color.
meanings.sent3: The fluky rain shower caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her fluky discovery of the hidden treasure amazed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The fluky opportunity to travel abroad changed my life forever.

meanings.definition: Characterized by good luck or fortune.
meanings.sent1: She had a fluky streak of winning every game she played.
meanings.sent2: Winning the lottery was a fluky event that changed his life.
meanings.sent3: His fluky ability to always find parking spots amazed his friends.
meanings.sent4: The fluky charm on her bracelet seemed to bring good luck.
meanings.sent5: The fluky chance encounter led to a successful business partnership.

meanings.sent1: The fluky weather made planning the picnic difficult.
meanings.sent2: The stock market can be fluky, so it's hard to predict.
meanings.sent3: Her fluky mood swings kept everyone on their toes.
meanings.sent4: The fluky test results puzzled the doctors.
meanings.sent5: The fluky behavior of the machine caused delays in production.
